deck.paragraph: From the Gateway Centre we run a number of services for the benefit of the wider community.

right.deck: The Gateway Centre provides a context for much of our work with the community. The Centre is available for hire to local groups - contact [Wendy Neary](https://www.gatewaychurch.co.uk/people/Wendy%20Neary) for more details.

left.deck: We partner with the award-winning national charity Christians Against Poverty (CAP) to deliver a free debt advice service to those struggling with unmanageable debt. Our Debt Coaches, [Jackie Adie](https://www.gatewaychurch.co.uk/people/Jackie%20Adie) and [Lucy den Braber](https://www.gatewaychurch.co.uk/people/Lucy%20den%20Braber), work with individuals and families to support them out of debt. For more information you can visit the[ CAP website](https://capuk.org/) or call 0800 328 0006.

right.deck: On a Monday we run distribution sessions in partnership with [York Foodbank](https://york.foodbank.org.uk/), offering people in crisis 3 days of emergency food and a chance to talk and pray with one of our volunteers.

left.deck:
Several partner agencies run services and projects from the Gateway Centre.
They include [Reflect Pregnancy Support](https://reflectyork.co.uk/), [Restore York](https://www.restoreyork.co.uk/), [Tiny Toes Music](https://www.tinytoesmusic.co.uk/) and [Alcoholics Anonymous](https://www.alcoholics-anonymous.org.uk/).
